properties.areaDesc: East Santa Barbara Channel from Pt. Conception to Pt. Mugu CA including Santa Cruz Island; Inner waters from Point Mugu to San Mateo Pt. CA including Santa Catalina and Anacapa Islands
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 4 at 3:22AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
GUSTY WINDS AND STEEP NORTHEAST WAVES WILL AFFECT CATALINA ISLAND
INCLUDING AVALON HARBOR AND TWO HARBORS THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING...

Gale force northeast winds of 20 to 30 knots with gusts to 35 knots
will affect much of the inner coastal waters from Ventura southward
to San Mateo Point this morning, and will also affect Anacapa, Santa
Cruz and Catalina Islands.

Winds are expected to decrease some this afternoon, but north to
northeast winds of 15 to 25 knots are expected tonight and
Wednesday morning across the inner waters from Point Mugu to Santa
Monica and south of Palos Verdes out to Catalina Island.

Strong northeast winds and choppy northeast wind swell of 3 to 5
feet will affect the northeast facing harbors on Catalina Island,
including Avalon Harbor and Two Harbors.

These conditions have a history of vessel damage and loss of life.
Mariners should avoid these areas, or remain in safe harbor until
conditions improve. Avalon Harbor and Two Harbors should NOT be
considered safe harbors during this event..

NWSheadline: GALE FORCE NORTHEAST WINDS ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE INNER WATERS AND EASTERN PORTIONS OF THE SANTA BARBARA CHANNEL THIS MORNING
